alert.note: Alert for Lauderdale; Newton (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 25 at 2:56PM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of eastern Newton and northwestern Lauderdale Counties through 330 PM CDT... At 256 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Meehan, or 9 miles west of Meridian, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Meridian, Suqualena and Nellieburg around 305 PM CDT. Martin around 310 PM CDT. Meridian Station and Daleville around 320 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Chunky and Hickory. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. High winds can bring down trees and large limbs resulting in serious injury or property damage. Exercise extreme caution when outdoors during such strong winds...and be especially aware of older trees. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 500 PM CDT for east central Mississippi.
